overview: This file controls global Act functionalities including item levels, monster behaviors, and waypoints  This file uses the wanderingmon.txt file for a modular list of potential wandering units to spawn  Any column field name starting with “*” is considered a comment field and is not used by the game

data_fields.name: act
data_fields.description: Defines the ID for the Act

data_fields.name: town
data_fields.description: Uses an area level (“Name field” from levels.txt) to define the Act’s town area

data_fields.name: start
data_fields.description: Uses an area level (“Name field” from levels.txt) to define where the player starts in the Act

data_fields.name: maxnpcitemlevel
data_fields.description: Controls the maximum item level for items sold by the NPC in the Act

data_fields.name: classlevelrangestart
data_fields.description: Uses an area level (“Name field” from levels.txt) with its MonLvl values as a global Act minimum monster level. For example, this is used to determine chest levels in an Act.

data_fields.name: classlevelrangeend
data_fields.description: Uses an area level (“Name field” from levels.txt) with its MonLvl values as a global Act maximum monster level. For example, this is used to determine chest levels in an Act.

data_fields.name: wanderingnpcstart
data_fields.description: Uses an index to determine which wandering monster class to use when populating areas (See wanderingmmon.txt for a list of possible monsters to spawn)

data_fields.name: wanderingnpcrange
data_fields.description: This is a modifier that gets added to the “wanderingnpcstart” value to randomly select an index

data_fields.name: commonactcof
data_fields.description: Specifies which “.D2” file to use as for the common Act COF file. This is used to establish the seed when initializing the Act.

data_fields.name: waypoint1 (to waypoint9)
data_fields.description: Uses an area level (“Name field” from levels.txt) as the designated waypoint selection in the Waypoint UI

data_fields.name: wanderingMonsterPopulateChance
data_fields.description: The percent chance (from 0 to 100) to spawn a wandering monster (See wanderingmmon.txt for a list of possible monsters to spawn)

data_fields.name: wanderingMonsterRegionTotal
data_fields.description: The maximum number of wandering monsters allowed at once

data_fields.name: wanderingPopulateRandomChance
data_fields.description: A secondary percent chance (from 0 to #) to determine whether to attempt populating with monsters. Only fails if random chance selects 0.
